# Probability Mass Function

> [Degenerate distribution][degenerate-distribution] [probability mass function][pmf] (PMF).

<section class="intro">

</section>

<!-- /.intro -->

<section class="usage">

## Usage

```javascript
const pmf = require( '@stdlib/stats/base/dists/degenerate/pmf' );
```

#### pmf( x, mu )

Evaluates the [PMF][pmf] of a [degenerate distribution][degenerate-distribution] centered at `mu`.

```javascript
let y = pmf( 2.0, 8.0 );
// returns 0.0

y = pmf( 8.0, 8.0 );
// returns 1.0
```

#### pmf.factory( mu )

Returns a function for evaluating the [PMF][pmf] of a [degenerate distribution][degenerate-distribution] centered at `mu`.

```javascript
const mypmf = pmf.factory( 10.0 );

let y = mypmf( 10.0 );
// returns 1.0

y = mypmf( 5.0 );
// returns 0.0

y = mypmf( 12.0 );
// returns 0.0
```

</section>

<!-- /.usage -->

<section class="examples">

## Examples

<!-- eslint no-undef: "error" -->

```javascript
const randu = require( '@stdlib/random/base/randu' );
const round = require( '@stdlib/math/base/special/round' );
const pmf = require( '@stdlib/stats/base/dists/degenerate/pmf' );

for ( let i = 0; i < 100; i++ ) {
    const x = round( randu()*5.0 );
    const mu = round( randu()*5.0 );
    const y = pmf( x, mu );
    console.log( 'x: %d, µ: %d, P(X=x;µ): %d', x, mu, y );
}
```

</section>

<!-- /.examples -->
